Package gui.UserScreens

Class LogInScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.ScreenController
gui.UserScreens.LogInScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class LogInScreenController extends ScreenController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is responsible for the log in screen of the application. It contains methods for initializing the view, handling events related to logging in, and exiting the program.
Author:
Lior Jigalo

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the log in screen by setting text fields and buttons, and adding event handlers for the "Enter" key to submit the log in form.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location of the FXML file associated with this controller.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object.

    • exit

      void exit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "Exit" button. Closes the program.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the mouse clicking the "Exit" button.

    • openForgotPasswordScreen

      void openForgotPasswordScreen(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      UNUSED IN FINAL FORM Handles the event of the user clicking the "Forgot Password" button. Shows an alert message that this functionality is not yet supported.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the mouse clicking the "Forgot Password" button.

    • FastlogIn

      private void FastlogIn(javafx.event.Event event)
      TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTION will work later with EKT app. Handles the event of the user clicking the "Fast Login" button. Sends a message to the server to log in with predefined credentials "ron" and "123" and switches to the appropriate screen depending on the user's department and if EK or OL
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "Fast Login" button.

    • logIn

      private void logIn(javafx.event.Event event)
      Handles the event of the user clicking the "Log In" button or pressing the "Enter" key in the username or password field. Sends a message to the server with the entered username and password, and switches to the appropriate screen depending on the user's department and if EK or OL.
      Parameters:
      event - The event of the user clicking the "Log In" button or pressing the "Enter" key in the username or password field.

    • loadRoot

      private javafx.scene.Parent loadRoot()
      Loads the appropriate screen for the user based on their department, and sets the current customer if applicable.
      Returns:
      The Parent root of the appropriate screen.

    • getUsernameAndPassword

      private ArrayList<String> getUsernameAndPassword()
      Retrieves the username and password entered by the user and returns it in an ArrayList. If one of the fields is empty or contains spaces, an error message is displayed.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing the username and password entered by the user, or null if the fields are empty or contain spaces.
